meanings.definition: A loud, harsh cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The scraichs of the thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: I heard the scraichs of the seagulls as they flew overhead.
meanings.sent3: The scraichs of the baby pretending to be a dinosaur made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The scraichs of the wind through the trees sounded like a haunted house.
meanings.sent5: The scraichs of the brakes screeching made me jump.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The cat scraichs when it wants attention.
meanings.sent2: She scraichs in pain when she stubs her toe.
meanings.sent3: The old car scraichs to a stop in front of the house.
meanings.sent4: The rusty gate scraichs open as I push it.
meanings.sent5: The violin scraichs as the bow moves across the strings.
